Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2013 01:39PM babs1208 wrote: I don't have abdominal pain "just" bone mets. But I love my pain doc. As he says when my pain gets out do hand-- "don't worry I have lots of arrows in my quiver". I say find a really good pain clinic. As for MM (med marijuana) I have several tinctures (liquid) with several different effects. I have most success with one that relaxes me to be able to sleep. But if your state has dispensaries-talk to them. They are a wealth of info.
Posts.Title: Could use a good idea or two sueopp formygirls

Posts.Content: babs1208 wrote: I was disgnosed with Stage IV mets in November. I never had any breast cancer before (even with diligent screening) so I'm really new to this world. Had radiation but no chemo and no breast surgery. I has 7 hours of back surgery to repair a burst vertabrae instead.  Have been on femara with decent results but not a home run. My dr wants to put me on aromasin and afinitor since I am a "perfect match" for the drugs. Read there are some pretty disruptive side effects- mouth sores, aching, etc.  Any ideas for how to mitigate some of these side effects? Thanks wise sisters! Dx 11/20/2012, IDC, Stage IV, Grade 2, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Hormonal Therapy 11/24/2012 Femara (letrozole) Radiation Therapy 11/28/2012 3DCRT: Bone, Brain Hormonal Therapy 6/1/2013 Aromasin (exemestane) Targeted Therapy 6/1/2013 Afinitor (everolimus) Radiation Therapy 6/10/2013 3DCRT: Bone Chemotherapy 8/29/2013 Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Managing side effects of aromasin and afinitor babs1208 sueco

Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2013 02:40PM babs1208 wrote: I've been taking femera for 4 months. Just recently I'm experiencing joint and muscle pain. Have wicked pain in right hip due to tumors in pelvic area. Hard to tell if the joint pain is frommets or side effect of femera.  Anyone have joint pain with femera?
